text: Thallium(I) fluoride, also known as thallous fluoride, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is TlF. It has thallium and fluoride ions. The thallium is in its +1 oxidation state. ==Properties== Thallium(I) fluoride is a white solid. It dissolves easily in water. It also dissolves in ethanol. It absorbs a little water in wet air. ==Preparation== It is made by reacting thallium(I) oxide or thallium(I) carbonate with hydrofluoric acid. ==Related pages== *Thallium(III) oxide *Thallium(I) chloride ==References== Category:Thallium compounds Category:Fluorine compounds
title: Thallium(I) fluoride
